title: What to know about possible Red Sox free agent target Munetaka Murakami after posting
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Munetaka Murakami, known as the 'Japanese Babe Ruth,' has been posted by Tokyo Yakult Swallows for MLB teams' bids.
The Red Sox are viewed as potential suitors for Murakami, especially if Alex Bregman departs in free agency.
Concerns exist about Murakami's high strikeout rates, which might worsen when facing MLB pitchers.

title: Airlines are waiving fees, offering refunds due to reduced flight schedules
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Airlines are waiving fees and offering refunds as FAA reduces flights by 10% at 40 airports, including Logan.
JetBlue waives change fees and fare differences for flights Nov. 6-10; full refunds offered for cancellations booked by Nov. 5.
Delta offers refunds or eCredits for cancellations; fare difference waived for rebooked travel by Nov. 21 in the same service cabin.

title: After Cape Cod crash, readers say Mass. should tighten e-bike regulations
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Cape Cod crash involving e-bike reignites debate over tougher regulations for electric bikes in Massachusetts.
A Boston.com poll shows 78% of 580 readers support stricter e-bike laws, while 20% oppose them, citing effectiveness concerns.
Massachusetts currently defines e-bikes as Class 1 and 2, both unlicensed, with Class 3 unregulated despite exceeding 20 mph.

title: Watch: Dog rescued from Ted Williams Tunnel
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts State Police rescued a dog from the Ted Williams Tunnel Thursday morning.
The dog was retrieved safely after initially evading capture and hopping into a police cruiser.
MassDOT surveillance captured the incident, showing the trooper stopping traffic to rescue the dog.

title: Canterbury Farm, ‘a treasure to the Berkshires,’ closes after 40 years
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Canterbury Farm in Becket, MA, closed after 40 years, following Linda and Dave Bacon's retirement announcement.
The 200-acre property offered cross-country skiing, lodging, and events, impacting the community and attracting New England travelers.
Challenges included weather conditions and competition from Airbnb, influencing the Bacons' decision to retire.

title: Patriots will be without three key players for matchup vs. Buccaneers
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Patriots' Rhamondre Stevenson, Kayshon Boutte, and Christian Elliss ruled out for Sunday against Buccaneers due to injuries.
Stevenson missed last week; TreVeyon Henderson and Terrell Jennings likely to share backfield duties again.
Kayshon Boutte leads Patriots in receiving touchdowns and will miss game; Elliss is second in tackles with 53.

title: Is Drake Maye the MVP? Execs don’t think so, but several analysts do.
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Drake Maye has helped the Patriots to a 7-2 start, showing top statistics among NFL quarterbacks.
League executives are skeptical of Maye's MVP chances, with him receiving only one out of 42 votes.
Analysts like Nate Tice and Dan Orlovsky support Maye for MVP, citing his impact and advanced metrics.

title: Who makes the best espresso martinis in Greater Boston?
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Boston.com seeks reader recommendations for the best espresso martinis in Greater Boston.
The espresso martini's popularity continues with variations including coconut and burnt sugar.
Readers can submit favorite spots via an online form or email for a future guide.

title: Travelers face delays, cancellations at Logan Airport after FAA names it among airports impacted by the shutdown
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Logan Airport faces delays and cancellations due to FAA reducing air traffic by 10% amid government shutdown.
By 2 p.m. Friday, Logan recorded 107 flight delays and 38 cancellations, according to FlightAware.
Massport urges passengers to check with airlines as delays and cancellations are expected in coming days.

title: 10 noteworthy stats after a month of hockey for 2025-26 Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins have improved defensively, reducing expected goals against to 1.89 per 60 minutes over the last three games.
Hampus Lindholm's return has bolstered Boston's defense, with their penalty kill efficiency rising to 96.6% when he's in the lineup.
The Bruins' 5-on-5 goal-scoring with Pastrnak and Geekie has dipped to 1.87 per 60 minutes compared to last season's 4.19.
